intro: Hibbertia cunninghamii var. latifolia, commonly known as the broad-leafed hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its yellow flowers with red centers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is found in regions of southern Australia. It features narrow, linear leaves and produces fruit that splits open to release seeds. Hibbertia cunninghamii var. latifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens.
